page.title: 07Farming in Brenchley
page.content: Little Dunks Farm is one of only two {dairy farms}in the area.It has 160 acres of pasture and 40 acres of woodland.There are 75 cows(Friesians) in milk and 30 followers (from calves to cows due to milk next season).The farm is worked by the farmer and his two sons.The second dairy farm is nearby Champness Old Farm with a similar herd and acreage. Also nearby is Coldharbour Farm which has mainly pigs,sheep and cereals. At Brattles Grange{a herd of deer graze 49 acres of pasture and a field of kale is grown for feed. On Becketts Grove Farm 88 cattle are reared for{beef}on 93 acres. Cross breeds give better beef prices.Those fattened are Friesian/Hereford, Charolais/Symmental and Limousin/ Hereford.Free range{chicken and duck {eggs}are sold at Tonbridge WI market.
